jcr:content.jcr:title: Grammy Award for Best Soul Gospel Performance, Female

contentheadline.headline: Grammy Award for Best Soul Gospel Performance, Female

contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} The [[Grammy Award]] for '''Best Soul Gospel Performance, Female''' was awarded from 1984 to 1989. In 1990 this award was combined with the award for [[Grammy Award for Best Soul Gospel Performance, Male|Best Soul Gospel Performance, Male]] as the [[Grammy Award for Best Soul Gospel Performance, Male or Female]]. Years reflect the year in which the Grammy Awards were presented, for works released in the previous year. ==1980s== *[[Grammy Awards of 1989]] **[[Aretha Franklin]] for ''One Lord, One Faith, One Baptism'' *[[Grammy Awards of 1988]] **[[CeCe Winans]], "For Always" *[[Grammy Awards of 1987]] **[[Deniece Williams]] for "I Surrender All" *[[Grammy Awards of 1986]] **[[Shirley Caesar]] for "Martin" *[[Grammy Awards of 1985]] **Shirley Caesar for ''Sailin' '' *[[Grammy Awards of 1984]] **[[Sandra Crouch]] for ''We Sing Praises'' {{DEFAULTSORT:Grammy Award For Best Soul Gospel Performance, Female}} [[Category:Grammy Awards for gospel music]]
